subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_020E_01C9BDF2.9B9701F0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="utf-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yes, I agree, we have to start somewhere.

If I could, I would. But Hubby w=
on't let me play with my Ouija board :(

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  =
From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, April 15, 2009 =
5:39 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunt=
er stuff.






        Just testing with me (my one lonely data point) is =
not as subjective as one person asking their board open-ended questions, bu=
t I agree it is also not as objective as it could be with more people, or p=
erhaps more randomized data sources.

        So while I still have my one =
data point test open to anyone who would like to test their board, we can a=
lso add future tests, with other people, or other "answer" sources.  That w=
ould add to the reliability of the performance statistics, while collecting=
 more data.

        But I think it's best to do one test at a time, yes?  =
So, might as well begin with mine, for those who are so inclined to begin t=
esting, and then see where we go from there.

        --- On Wed, 4/15/09, =
April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


          F=
rom: April Abercrombie <april@...>
          Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
     =
     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Wednesday, April 15, 2009,=
 4:18 PM


          =EF=BB=BF 

          "Asking the board open-ended que=
stions, and interpreting the results, is subjective. Asking for a specific,=
 predetermined number is not subjective.  It is about as objective as you c=
an get."

          Your test is subjective in that it is based on just you=
r influence. Therefore, all we can test with it is your influence on the bo=
ard. Add a few more people to the study, then we can objectify it a little =
more.

          In the second paragraph, the test you outlined with testin=
g the 2 people, is not subjective, because you have more then just one pers=
on. It would even be better with a few more test subjects.


          "My =
test is not for those who believe it is statistically likely that psychic t=
ampering would occur, or that the board=E2=80=99s performance is just not t=
estable, which is the camp I gather you are in."

          Not at all. I d=
o not have any opinion either way if the board can or can't be psychically =
influence, because I do not know. I do think the board can be tested for ce=
rtain things. I just don't think your test using just you would tell us muc=
h in the grand scheme of things. This is not meant to pick on you in any wa=
y, I do think it the test you have proposed would be interesting.


       =
     ----- Original Message ----- 
            From: Rj 
            To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, April 15, 2009 4:57 PM=

            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost h=
unter stuff.


                  Asking the board open-ended questions, and=
 interpreting the results, is subjective. Asking for a specific, predetermi=
ned number is not subjective.  It is about as objective as you can get. 

 =
                 I am not trying to prove anything, or rule out any possibi=
lities.  I am suggesting a method to determine, statistically, how accurate=
 someone=E2=80=99s board, or methodology, might be.  Lets say I select two =
people, and in separate rooms, I give each a spelling test.  Person 1 gets =
100% right.  Person 2 gets 50% right.  Now, if I later give them a second s=
pelling test, I can start with the theory that Person 1 will get near 100% =
correct, and Person 2 will get near 50% correct.  This doesn=E2=80=99t mean=
 they will, or that they have gotten these scores in the past.  But statist=
ically, it is a reasonable assumption at this point.  After the second test=
, I can examine the deviation of the results from the first test, and updat=
e the statistics.   If the deviation remains small (if the results remain s=
imilar), then I can more and more safely assume that person 1 will have a v=
ery high chance of getting a word right, and person 2 will have half that. =
 If the deviation swings wildly, than my statistics may not be very predict=
ive after all.

                  The same is true with the board.  As you =
said, getting this number wrong doesn=E2=80=99t say past answers were wrong=
, or that future answers will be wrong.  And it is possible it could have b=
een right by mere chance (though very unlikely: winning the lottery is more=
 likely than guessing one number out of a billion).  What we=E2=80=99d have=
 is one single objective data point.  It gives a starting point for reasona=
ble assumptions.  As you noted, after more such tests, those assumptions ma=
y start changing.  It would be interesting to see how they change, if they =
do.

                  Different people seem to have different feelings abo=
ut the board.  Some believe it gives great results.  Some are suspicious, e=
ven dubious.  And there are plenty of opinions in between.  My test is not =
for those who believe it is statistically likely that psychic tampering wou=
ld occur, or that the board=E2=80=99s performance is just not testable, whi=
ch is the camp I gather you are in.  My test is only good for that segment =
of this population who believes or wonders if the board is capable of givin=
g a straight objective answer to a straight objective questions, and that s=
uch performance is testable.  To address one of your examples, while it can=
not show that an entity is reading my mind if it gets the numbers right, it=
 can conversely show that an actual entity is not reading my mind (or that =
it is not performing remote viewing, or that it is not predicting the futur=
e of what the right answer is when it is revealed, or that it is not being =
forthright in its answers) if it cannot get the numbers right in the first =
place.  But if these things are true, then it begs the question of its accu=
racy anyway.

                  So again, this is one data point, in what c=
ould be a number of tests, for those who are not ruling out that testing is=
 possible, and even desirable, when believing, or acting on, information ga=
thered by using this kind of board.  


                  --- On Wed, 4/15/=
09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


     =
               From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. co=
m>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usu=
al ghost hunter stuff.
                    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
   =
                 Date: Wednesday, April 15, 2009, 2:45 PM



              =
      It's not that I don't want to test it, it is that I can't. It would b=
e interesting and I would do it if I could.

                    But again,=
 this test could really only rule out psychic interference from you. It is =
too subjective and therefore cannot stand as a measurement for other tests =
of this nature by itself.

                    If it failed to get your num=
ber, that would not mean that it couldn't get someone else's number or that=
 someone else couldn't influence it. That would also not mean that answers =
it had gotten in the past weren't correct, coming from a living being or a =
spirit.  It would not prove anything, except that it was not acting on any =
psychic vibrations from you personally.

                    If it got your=
 number correct, that doesn't even help immediately, because it could get t=
he answer on mere chance.

                    The only way to prove here t=
hat it is being psychically influenced would be to run several tests of the=
 same nature. Then, if it scored correct higher then mere chance, only then=
 could you say that the board can be psychically tampered with. Still, that=
 is the only thing you could say for certain. That would not rule out the p=
ossibility that spirits can communicate through it.

                     S=
o we would be left with more questions. Is it that it is being psychically =
tampered with by a human mind directly? Is it and actual entity reading som=
eone's mind? Can it be both?

                    See what I am sayin'?


 =
                     ----- Original Message ----- 
                      Fr=
om: Rj 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
               =
       Sent: Wednesday, April 15, 2009 3:03 PM
                      Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.


    =
                        If you don't want to test it, I understand.  This i=
s only a suggestion for people who want to test it.  An objective test, suc=
h as this, would be I think a good way to determine its accuracy.  And its =
accuracy is what carries over into its overall performance and value.  If y=
ou have no measurement as to the accuracy of its results, or of a given met=
hodology, then that brings into questions its overall results, and so, its =
other answers.

                            Again, though, if you don't wan=
t to test it, I understand.

                            --- On Wed, 4/15/0=
9, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


      =
                        From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostres=
earch. com>
                              Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alt=
ernative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
                              To:=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                              Date: Wednesday, Ap=
ril 15, 2009, 1:48 PM



                              "> If it can't get i=
t correct, I suppose that brings into suspect all its other answers."

    =
                          All that really does is rule out psychic interfer=
ence from you and the operator. So that would say nothing either way about =
all its other answers.


                                ----- Original Mes=
sage ----- 
                                From: Rick 
                   =
             To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                =
Sent: Wednesday, April 15, 2009 2:24 PM
                                Sub=
ject: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.



    =
                            Anyone have any luck with this calibration expe=
riment?

                                (Note this experiment isn't for an=
yone who just likes to play around with their board, and doesn't really car=
e to know its accuracy. This is for those interested in determining how wel=
l their board approach works).

                                --- In EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Rick" <rasterer@.. .> wrote:
                       =
         >
                                > If anyone feels like calibrati=
ng their board, or wants to know if they can get accurate information from =
it, I have written down a number between 1 and a billion (1,000,000,000)
  =
                              > 
                                > Let me k=
now what your board thinks it is. 
                                > If it =
gets it correct, sounds like you've got something important going on there!=

                                > 
                                > If it=
 can't get it correct, I suppose that brings into suspect all its other ans=
wers.
                                > 
                                > =

                                > 
                                > 
    =
                            > 
                                > --- In EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "threadsintyme@ " <Threadsintyme@ > wrote:
         =
                       > >
                                > > Hi Lori,
   =
                             > > Glad that you brought this up! A true medi=
um can give you a lot of the details that Ouija boards can't. They can also=
 give you complete names, dates, info that is totally unknown to others (ex=
cept for those directly involved). 
                                > > The=
re are some excellent readings on YouTube and I don't mean the crappy ones.=
..I forgot what this one guy's name was (he is in spirit now) but he could =
tel you details!! I almost my skin chill...
                               =
 > > I will see if I can locate some of those highly respected members of S=
piritualism and will post those here for all of you to watch.
             =
                   > > Blessings,
                                > > Al
  =
                              > > 
                                > > ----=
------ Original Message ----------
                                > > From=
: lori bogren <loribogren@ >
                                > > To: <evp-i=
tc@yahoogroups .com>
                                > > Subject: RE: [EVP-=
ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
                      =
          > > Date: Fri, 10 Apr 2009 19:11:33 -0500
                       =
         > > 
                                > > 
                        =
        > > 
                                > > 
                         =
       > > April~
                                > > 
                    =
            > > You forgot yawn from boredom, that's what I do.
           =
                     > > 
                                > > Use it, don't=
 use it. I don't care. But why bother. When people ask me I usually suggest=
 that if they want to communicate with ... whatever why not develop the abi=
lity yourself. - ya, I'm one of those who believe anyone can.
             =
                   > > 
                                > > There's always =
the question in the back of your mind whether your partner's moving it. The=
 intentions of "what" you are talking to. Not to mention it's too slow and =
limited.
                                > > 
                             =
   > > Besides if you take the time to develop the ability you can get more=
 texture in the information. Asking the board "where you married?" may get =
you a "yes" but a psychic might get the sense of a religious or civil cerem=
onhy, the garment(s) worn, other's in the party, or whether that Being appr=
oved/disapprove d of their spouse (ie was it a reluctant union).
          =
                      > > 
                                > > ~Lori
      =
                          > > 
                                > > "My life=
 is boring, my fantasies are a theme park." --Anne Rice Responding to an in=
terviewer who just did not get it. 
                                > > 
  =

            =

te: Fri, 10 Apr 2009 08:32:45 -0600

ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
       =

                                > > .Yeah-tha=
t's the problem with it I have found too. Most people, when you mention Oui=
